purpose: Minimal NixOS configuration for beta-one, an ARM-based device (likely Raspberry Pi), optimized for cross-compilation and SD card image generation with disabled documentation and base profiles.
nixos_patterns: sdImage for generating bootable SD card images
integration_points: Cross-compilation support from x86_64 build to armv7l host
Serial console configuration for headless operation
notes: This configuration targets a Raspberry Pi 2 or similar ARMv7 device, using ext4 filesystem on an SD card labeled NIXOS_SD. It disables compression for the SD image, sets kernel parameters for serial console on ttyS1 and CMA allocation. Cross-compilation is configured with build platform x86_64-linux and host platform armv7l-linux. The generic-extlinux-compatible bootloader is enabled instead of GRUB. Documentation, all-hardware, and base profiles are disabled for a minimal system. A 1GB swap file is configured. Commented-out sections include WireGuard enable, full configuration import, alternative kernel packages, and more complex cross-system definitions. This appears to be a bootstrap or minimal image for ARM devices in the network. Reasoning: The focus on cross-compilation, minimal modules, and SD image generation suggests this is used for deploying NixOS to resource-constrained ARM hardware, possibly for testing or secondary services in the home lab.
